common_issues.title: Pieces OS High CPU Usage and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high CPU usage, slow performance, and system lag, particularly with Long Term Memory (LTM) enabled. Issues are prevalent across Windows versions and impact applications like Discord and MS Edge. Proposed solutions include Pieces OS updates, Edge and WebView2 updates, and moving Pieces OS folders with symbolic links. While patches show marginal improvements, the root cause is still under investigation.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

**Key points raised:**

* High CPU usage with Pieces OS on various versions (11.2.1 and 11.2.2) and platforms (Windows 10, Windows 11).
* Issues specifically noted with Discord and MS Edge.
* CPU usage particularly high with Long Term Memory engine (LTM2).

**Problems identified:**

* High CPU usage impacting performance.
* Specific applications (Discord, MS Edge) causing hiccups.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Hotfixes released by the Pieces team.
* Update to Microsoft Edge and WebView2 Runtime.
* Moving com.pieces.os/com.pieces.pfd folder to another drive and creating symbolic links.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Patch for high CPU issue has been released, resulting in some marginal improvements.
* Updating Edge and WebView2 resolves the issue with MS Edge.
* Moving com.pieces.os/com.pieces.pfd folder and creating symbolic links shows promise but needs further testing.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue appears to be highly related to LTM2.
* Further investigation into the root cause is ongoing.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Discussion: High Memory and CPU Usage in Pieces OS

**Key Points Raised:**
* Pieces OS has been experiencing high memory and CPU usage, impacting user experience and performance.
* This issue has been prevalent across various platforms, including Windows, Linux, and macOS.
* The memory usage issue is attributed to numerous factors, including ML models, data processing, and the new Live Context feature.

**Problems Identified:**
* High RAM usage, exceeding 2GB even with no models running.
* CPU spikes reaching 100% and slowing down entire systems.
* Background processes continuously consuming resources.
* Memory leaks causing instability.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* Implementing a "lite" mode with reduced functionalities and resource demands.
* Replacing heavy database technologies in PiecesOS 11.1.0 to improve CPU and memory usage.
* Optimizing ML models and data processing for better efficiency.
* Allowing users to set process affinity to specific cores (e.g., E-cores) for better temperature management.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* The release of PiecesOS 11.1.0 has reportedly reduced CPU usage for some users.
* Further improvements are planned and under development.
* The issue of high memory usage persists for some users, even after the LTM-2 update.
* The team is still actively investigating and addressing the problems.

**Conclusion:**
The Pieces OS team is aware of the high memory and CPU usage issues and actively working on solutions. While some improvements have been made, further optimization is needed. Users can expect additional updates and improvements in future releases.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I enable Long term memory engine on and use it on pieces for dev or vscode when I try to prompt anything, piecesOS shit's off and starts looping on restart until I manage in the seconds it stays on to disable the LTM engine.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rafael reported an issue with LTM on Pieces OS.
* The Pieces support bot provided helpful resources and related issues.
* Mark, a Pieces team member, acknowledged the issue and apologized for the delay.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM was experiencing issues on Pieces OS.
* The support team was delayed in responding due to a large release.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark suggested waiting for the upcoming Pieces OS 11.2.0 release.
* Mark offered to schedule a call to discuss the issue further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue status is unclear.
* The user is advised to wait for the upcoming release or schedule a call with Mark. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place in February and March 2025.
* The issue seems related to the transition from LTM to LTM2.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Personal Domain and Backup Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS personal domain setup and backup/restore functionality.  Problems include domain registration failures, UI glitches, and data loss during restore. Proposed solutions involve verifying domain availability, refreshing the restore process, and troubleshooting potential conflicts between local and cloud data.

related_issues.title: Personal Domain backup
related_issues.text:
Personal Domain backup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I want to sync this PC to another PC，but i cann't backup the lastest data.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bfb4fb14-5e7f-45c7-828f-5f77f550453a)

this is another PC

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c2d880e-a1b2-40c1-82b1-9935bffbf8fb)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* laborer123 is unable to change their personal domain after copying com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd to another PC.
* They are also experiencing difficulties restoring a backup.

**Problems Identified:**

* The personal domain laborer123 is trying to register may already be taken.
* The backup/restore process may be overriding local data with the cloud backup.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggests laborer123 try registering a new domain to verify functionality.
* They also advise clicking the refresh icon to initiate the restore process, which may override local data.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* It is unclear whether laborer123 has successfully registered a new domain or restored their backup.
* Mark-at-pieces is available to provide further assistance if needed.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation includes screenshots of the personal domain registration and restore process.

**Overall, the issue appears to be resolved, but further confirmation from laborer123 is necessary.**

related_issues.title: Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS causes gray space to appear
related_issues.text:
Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS causes gray space to appear
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I attempt to fill in the field for personal domain under Pieces OS settings, the moment I start typing an enormous empty gray space appears. 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ba417a8-9685-4379-b278-176715101c69
## Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* DailenG reported an issue causing the Pieces OS to not run.
* DailenG provided details to help diagnose the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS wouldn't run.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team investigated and identified the cause of the issue.
* A patch was developed and included in a hotfix release (v4.0.1) for the Desktop app.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The hotfix has been deployed and should resolve the issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* The Pieces support team provided helpful resources and a timeline for updates.
* DailenG's contribution helped improve the Pieces OS.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:**

* User MoyinShabi is unable to connect Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.

**Key Points:**

* User has not received any health check notifications on their desktop.
* Issue potentially related to user's desktop app's database.
* Issue not reproducible by support team but a bug fix implemented. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support team requested user's log files and "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* Support team identified and fixed a bug in the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* A repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder was provided to the user.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User still experiencing the issue after replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* User found an error message related to the GetIt package in their log files.

**Next Steps:**

* Support team needs to investigate the GetIt error further to identify the root cause and provide a solution. 
* User needs to monitor the situation and provide any additional information that may be helpful.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers conflicts with other software
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces for Developers and other software, particularly Visual Studio 2022 and the Pieces Desktop app. These conflicts manifest as UI issues, application crashes, or failure to launch. Solutions include restarting applications, disabling extensions, reinstalling software, and replacing corrupted files. The Pieces team actively investigates and addresses these issues through bug fixes and hotfixes.

related_issues.title: Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
related_issues.text:
Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

With Pieces Extension installed in Visual studio 2022, SQL database field is not editable (not clickable?)

Reproduce: 
- Connect to any SQL server with some table, choose a table and right click -> View Data
- Try edit the database's table field (the field will be unable to focus, so unable to edit)

* SQL database is editable again after disable pieces extension and restart VS.
* Try turn off everything in the extension's UserPreference did not work.
* While you can not edit a field, but delete a row is possible (so maybe some UI conflict?)

Here are some picture

Without the extension: the edit cursor shown up when click on field
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c45dbafe-29c7-4acd-9827-b34cd0cd76f7)

With the extension: the edit cursor did not show up. Clicking just selected the field.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f430ff6-18f8-41fe-a58e-42ebbeec3be2)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @hikineet98 reported an issue with the product.
* The issue was automatically triaged and assigned to the Pieces support team.
* Mark from Pieces support acknowledged the issue and added lead developer Robert to the conversation.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user experienced an issue with the product, but the specific problem is not clearly stated in the conversation excerpt provided.
* The cause of the issue was not immediately clear to the Pieces team.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Robert, the lead developer, confirmed that he was able to replicate the issue.
* However, a solution or fix is not mentioned in this conversation excerpt.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The Pieces team is investigating the issue.
* No updates on the status or outcome of the investigation are provided in this excerpt.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation continues beyond the provided excerpt. For a complete understanding of the issue and its resolution, please refer to the full conversation on GitHub.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Launch and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties launching Pieces OS and the Pieces Desktop app after updates. Issues include update failures, app getting stuck in loading states, and inability to connect to Pieces OS. Solutions involve reinstalling apps, updating dependencies, and providing log files for debugging. Some issues persist and require further investigation.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Update fails
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Update fails
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The notification popped up saying an update was available so I clicked Update and a few seconds later got this message box:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b14dc8ab-632a-4095-b45b-7bbaba3c70ce)

This is on a very fresh Windows 11 installation.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User @ThatRendle reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching on Windows.
* The issue appears to be related to Microsoft's App Installer technology.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS fails to launch on Windows.
* The cause might be an outdated App Installer.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update App Installer through the Microsoft Store.
* Investigate if the error occurs every time PiecesOS is launched manually.
* Verify if PiecesOS can be launched using the Desktop application or other integrations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still being investigated.
* The user hasn't responded to further inquiries.

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided conversation only covers the initial interaction. More information might be available in later comments. 
* The user was directed to relevant issues and resources for troubleshooting.

**Overall, the issue remains unresolved, and further investigation is needed.**

related_issues.title: Unable to launch Pieces as Pieces OS is not updating after multiple tries
related_issues.text: Unable to launch Pieces as Pieces OS is not updating after multiple tries ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version Unable to launch it, so I am not aware ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I have been trying to use Pieces since Sunday and the OS shows need update, but it is not able to update. How can I get it working? ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * @Haimantika reported an issue with PiecesOS unable to launch. * The issue was related to a problem in a previous release. **Problems Identified:** * PiecesOS was unable to launch. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * @Haimantika was advised to: * ensure the latest versions of PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop Application are installed. * provide logs if the issue persisted. * schedule a debugging session. * @Haimantika reinstalled the app and OS, resolving the issue. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue has been resolved and the conversation can be closed.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS across different operating systems. Issues include invalid port errors, dependency connection failures, and update problems. Solutions involve checking for updates, providing log files for analysis, and potential bug fixes.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Marius encountered an issue with the Pieces application.
* The Pieces Support Bot triaged the issue and provided resources for troubleshooting.
* Mark, a support representative, suspected a similar issue from another support channel.
* Mack, another support representative, requested the log file and offered a video call for live troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* Marius was experiencing an issue with the Pieces application, potentially related to a known issue on specific Linux machines.
* The exact cause of the issue was unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack requested the log file for analysis.
* Mack offered a video call for live troubleshooting (declined by Marius).
* Mack suggested updating to the latest version (4.0.0) of the Desktop App.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Marius' response to the update suggestion is unavailable.
* The issue's current status is unclear, but Marius is encouraged to update and report further if the issue persists.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place between February 24th and March 5th, 2025.
* The specific issue details are not provided in the conversation.

### Checked for Existing Issues?

11.2.0

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:**

* User MoyinShabi is unable to connect Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.

**Key Points:**

* User has not received any health check notifications on their desktop.
* Issue potentially related to user's desktop app's database.
* Issue not reproducible by support team but a bug fix implemented. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support team requested user's log files and "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* Support team identified and fixed a bug in the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* A repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder was provided to the user.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User still experiencing the issue after replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* User found an error message related to the GetIt package in their log files.

**Next Steps:**

* Support team needs to investigate the GetIt error further to identify the root cause and provide a solution. 
* User needs to monitor the situation and provide any additional information that may be helpful.

related_issues.title: Unable to launch Pieces as Pieces OS is not updating after multiple tries
related_issues.text: Unable to launch Pieces as Pieces OS is not updating after multiple tries ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version Unable to launch it, so I am not aware ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I have been trying to use Pieces since Sunday and the OS shows need update, but it is not able to update. How can I get it working? ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * @Haimantika reported an issue with PiecesOS unable to launch. * The issue was related to a problem in a previous release. **Problems Identified:** * PiecesOS was unable to launch. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * @Haimantika was advised to: * ensure the latest versions of PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop Application are installed. * provide logs if the issue persisted. * schedule a debugging session. * @Haimantika reinstalled the app and OS, resolving the issue. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue has been resolved and the conversation can be closed.

recommendations: **Address High CPU Usage:** Investigate and address the root cause of high CPU usage in Pieces OS, particularly related to Long Term Memory (LTM).
**Improve Personal Domain Experience:** Review and improve the user experience for personal domain setup, backup, and restore functionalities.
**Resolve Software Conflicts:** Continue to prioritize and address conflicts between Pieces for Developers, Visual Studio, and the Pieces Desktop app.
**Ensure Smooth Launch and Updates:** Focus on resolving issues related to launching and updating Pieces OS and the Desktop app.
**Enhance Connection Stability:** Investigate and improve the connection stability between Pieces for Developers and Pieces OS across all platforms.
**Proactive Communication:** Provide timely updates and communication to users regarding ongoing issues, especially those with high activity levels like ticket #650 and #658.
**Knowledge Base Expansion:** Create or update knowledge base articles addressing common issues like high CPU usage, personal domain problems, and software conflicts.
**Bug Tracking and Prioritization:** Implement a robust bug tracking system to prioritize and address issues based on frequency, severity, and user impact.
**Automated Testing:** Develop and implement automated tests to identify and prevent issues related to updates, software conflicts, and core functionalities.
**User Feedback Loop:** Establish a clear feedback loop to gather user insights and prioritize improvements based on real-world usage patterns and pain points.
